section.heading: Establishment of the Criminal Code Reform Commission.

para.text: The Criminal Code Reform Commission ("Commission"") is established as an independent agency, as that term is defined in § 1-603.01(13).
The Commission shall be composed of the Executive Director and such staff as necessary to complete the work of the Commission.

The Executive Director shall be appointed by the Chairman of the Council, in consultation with the chairperson of the Council committee with jurisdiction over the Commission, subject to the approval of a majority of the Council. The Executive Director shall serve for a term of 3 years.

Notwithstanding paragraph (1) of this subsection, as of October 8, 2016, the Criminal Code Revision Project Director of the District of Columbia Sentencing and Criminal Code Revision Commission shall be the Executive Director of the Commission.

The Executive Director shall receive an annual salary consistent with the District of Columbia Government Salary Schedule for Excepted Service (ES) employees, at no lower than Grade 10, exclusive of fringe benefits. The Executive Director serving as of July 13, 2022, shall receive such salary retroactive to March 26, 2022.
Be a member in good standing of the District of Columbia Bar;
Be responsible for and oversee the daily operations of the Commission;
Develop and institute internal policies, procedures, and processes to ensure efficient operations.
Except as provided in paragraph (2) of this subsection, all employees of the Commission shall be, or shall become within 180 days after hire, a resident of the District of Columbia
Notwithstanding paragraph (1) of this subsection, the Executive Director as of October 8, 2016 shall be exempt from the residency requirement in paragraph (1) of this subsection.
